page.title: 06INTERVIEW AT GROVE FARM.
page.content: The farmer's wife said"It's very nice to live on a farm."She also said that it can be very hard work.She has been on{Grove Farm}for 50 years.The farmhouse was built in 1866.Many years ago horses were kept to plough as there weren't any tractors.The farmer's son has about 5,000 chickens.Altogether there are 5,150 animals.Children go to Church Lench school from Radford,and then used to go to Worcester Grammar school.If you liked car racing when you left school you could go stock car racing.If you had lots of boys,the best place to live is on a farm.Turkeys sometimes get very excited at night and all you have to do is to get red windows to make the barn light and then they behave better. {N.B.GROVE FARM IS AT RADFORD.}
